review: I rebuilt my entire home wireless network with a new broadband modem and new wireless 300gbps dual router and wireless repeater and the Firestick still sucks at streaming.Why does it suck? hard to say. Sometimes you get an awesome picture but usually you get video quality that looks like its streaming to you all the way from the 90s. OR constant rebuffering so that you get to watch about 1 seconds of show for every 20 seconds of it pausing and telling you its rebuffering.This is a constant across and app. Netflix, Youtube, Sling TV (which has its own problems) and Crackle.The unsupported netflix and youtube apps on my 4 year old smart tv run better than this.Some people say its the hardware. Probably. Some people say it amazon server side messing up every thing you watch maybe.All I can say is that you will be unhappy. Unhappy like when you bought the Kindle Fire 1.0.

review: this item is very cool, but the description is misleading. I was lead to believe that once I get the stick, hook it up and sign up for amazon prime I'd be able to watch whatever I wanted to as much as I wanted to without being charged. however there are still a lot of shows that I want to watch that I have to pay for (rent or buy online). Many of my favorite shows are not available for free on prime and I wind up having to pay for them to see them.
